properties.areaDesc: Howard; Red River; Hempstead; McCurtain; Nevada; Sevier; Little River
properties.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued January 10 at 11:24AM CST until January 11 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Shreveport LA
properties.description:
...Flash Flooding threat late today and tonight North of I-30...

The Flash Flood Watch continues for

* Portions of southwest Arkansas, southeast Oklahoma, and
northeast Texas, including the following areas, in southwest
Arkansas, Hempstead, Howard, Little River, Nevada, and Sevier.
In southeast Oklahoma, McCurtain. In northeast Texas, Red
River.

* Through late tonight

* A strong system will bring heavy rainfall to portions of the
Middle Red River Valley of extreme Northeast Texas, Southeast
Oklahoma and portions of Southwest Arkansas Friday Afternoon
through Friday Night before the storm system moves east of the
region early on Saturday. Excessive rainfall capable of
producing flash flooding is possible.

* Widespread rainfall of near three inches with isolated higher
amounts will be possible. Dormant vegetation will allow heavy
rainfall to become runoff, raising the quick onset flash flood
threat.
properties.instruction:
A Flash Flood Watch means that conditions may develop that lead
to flash flooding. Flash flooding is a very dangerous situation.

You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action
should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

NWSheadline: FLASH FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE TONIGHT
